eb9b0185-215f-4c5f-a220-66afcd184480.description:
1. Creates a new customer in the database and links to the specified account holder customer record. This allows the account holder to perform actions on behalf of the related customer. Either the AccountHolderPatientID, or both the AccountHolderStoreReference and AccountHolderPatientReference, are required. The response includes the UserID and UserName of the AccountHolder. It also includes the AccountHolder PatientID, StoreReference, PatientReference, and Relationship of the linked patient and account holder.
  • By default, validation requirements of the SDS ePMS application apply. Some required data validations can be overridden by a web.config setting AllowMinimalPatientDetails set to true.
    • If any part of the PhoneNumber model is supplied, then all required keys in that model will be required.
    • PostalAddress can be supplied with ZipCode only. If any other portion of the PostalAddress model is included, all required keys in the model are then required.
    • If the TitleID is not supplied, the patient will be created with the 'Unknown' Title.
    • If the TitleID is supplied, the Sex is not required.
    • If Sex, or a TitleID which is associated with a Sex, is not supplied, the patient will be created with Sex as 'U' (Unknown).
    • DateOfBirth is not required if this setting is true. However, if it is included in the request, the value cannot be empty. To represent a NULL DateOfBirth, "1800-01-01" should be used.
    • This setting negates requirement of selection of a Preferred telephone number.
  • The title’s related sex will overwrite any sex value provided in the request.
  • If unspecified, WithMatchToExistingCustomer will be false.
  • Specific functionality if implemented by client request
    • If AllowEmail=False, Email must contain client specified email address.
    • If AllowEmail=True, Email may not contain client specified email address.
2. This is included within the following modules: Recall API, NVI eCommerce, SDS Scheduler 3. This is currently not Rate Limited 4. Available Versions: 1, 2 Version 2 contains new response node(s): InternationalCode, ApiVersion

b56f1dc3-372d-4f3e-a5f9-82a9a5d0713c.description:
1. Creates an Order Group for the supplied customer, store, and products. Notes
  • ShippingAddressId must be present on every order. ShippingAddressID in the request is used to identify which address orders will be shipped to. The response will return a new Order shipping address ID.
  • OrderValue will be ignored in the request.
  • OrderDate is used as supplied in the request. If not supplied, or set as 1800-01-01T00:00:00.000, then current date/time is populated in the order created by the request.
  • When the Payment value is higher than the OrderValue, the request will return a message 'Could Not Allocate Payment Correctly.' The order(s) will still be created and full payment of the actual order value will be taken. How to handle the payment overage will need to be handled internally.
  • OrderNumber, if specified - all order product types pertaining to that order must contain an AssociatedOrderNumber. Note: AssociatedOrderNumber must be unique for Warranty and Shipping.
  • OrderNumber, if not specified - all order product types pertaining to that order will use the next available order number in SDS.
  • OrderSubTypeCode, if not present- will use Store Default Order Sub Type for the spectacle and contact product types.
  • FrameSupplyType, if not present- will use Store Default Order Supply Type for the frame.
  • EdgeExternally, if not present- will use standard default of True.
  • Shipping added as part of the OrderDetail will supersede shipping entered as part of ShippingProduct.
  • Orders required to has a separate OrderGroup, the OrderDetail must be part of their own CartOrderGroup.
  • Pricing will need to be passed in the request for both OrderSaleTypes of Remake and Warranty if pricing will not be maintained in the SDS application.
  • OrderCollectionMethodType
    • ID Values
      • 1=PickupFromStore
      • 2=SupplierSendDirectToPatient
    • OrderCollectionMethodTypeID will allow either ID or Description.
    • OrderCollectionMethodTypeID=0 is not a valid option.
    • ShipToStoreReference is required when OrderCollectionMethodTypeID = 1
    • ShippingAddressID must be removed from request when OrderCollectionMethodTypeID = 1
    • OTC OrderType will have the OrderCollectionMethodType and ShipToStoreReference suppressed.
  • LabNotes: The following characters '\' (backslash) and '"' (double quote) are invalid and will have an impact to the JSON structure
  • The following items are not implemented in this method.
    • PrinterSettings Model
    • OrderSupplierTracking Model
    • OrderCourierTracking Model
    • OrderStatus Model
    • WarrantyAllowed key
  • OrderType and ProductType The value provided for OrderType will determine which keys in SDS.Optical.WebApi.Common.OrderProductDetail will be required. The following is a list of keys relevant to the OrderType and ProductType: OrderType: Spectacle
    • Product Type: SpectacleLens Side, ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription, UncutSize, MonoPD, SegHeight.
    • Product Type: SpectacleCoating, SpectacleTint, SpectacleTintQualifier, SpectacleService, Frame Side, ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription.
    • Product Type: FramePart, SpectaclePrism, Glazing N/A
    OrderType: ContactLens
    • Product Type: ContactLens Side, ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription, Quantity, BaseCurve, Diameter, OpticalZone, CenterThickness, HasLenticulation, ContactLensDot, CustomContactLens, SecondBaseCurve, SecondaryRadius, IntermediateRadius, PoweCurve, FirstWidth, SecondWidth, ThirdWidth
    • Product Type: ContactLensTint, ContactLensComposition Side, ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription
    • Product Type: CustomContactLens N/A
    OrderType: OTC
    • Product Type: OTC ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription, Quantity, AssociatedOrderNumber.
    OrderType: EyeExam - N/A
  • OrderSubTypeCode, if not present- will use Store Default Order Sub Type for the spectacle and contact product types.
  • FrameSupplyType, if not present- will use Store Default Order Supply Type for the frame.
  • EdgeExternally, if not present- will use standard default of True.
2. This is included within the following modules: Orders API, NVI eCommerce 3. This is currently not Rate Limited 4. Available Versions: 1, 2 Version 2 contains new response node(s): EdgeExternally, FrameSupplyType, SupplyType, OrderSubTypeCode, PatientEyecarePlanID, ApiVersion

    • `Identifier`: Patient identification details including `Forename`, `Surname`, `DateOfBirth`, `State`, and `ZipCode`.
    • `StoreReference`: Reference of the store to base the plan on.
  • If the plan does not exist, an error message will be returned.

041c74c5-57cf-47cf-9808-607a7d40ff8f.description:
1. Adds a new customer to the database using supplied data.
  • By default, validation requirements of the SDS ePMS application apply. Following optional keys in the InsertCustomerRequest model are required by the ePMS application: DateOfBirth, TitleID, Sex, PostalAddresses, TelephoneNumbers. Some required data validations can be overridden by a web.config setting AllowMinimalPatientDetails set to true. Note, if any part of the PhoneNumber model is supplied, then all required keys in that model will be required. PostalAddress can be supplied with ZipCode only. If any other portion of the PostalAddress model is included, all required keys in the model are then required.
    • If the TitleID is not supplied, the patient will be created with the 'Unknown' Title.
    • If the TitleID is supplied, the Sex is not required.
    • If Sex, or a TitleID which is associated with a Sex, is not supplied, the patient will be created with Sex as 'U' (Unknown).
    • DateOfBirth is not required if this setting is true. However, if it is included in the request, the value cannot be empty. To represent a NULL DateOfBirth, "1800-01-01" should be used.
    • This setting negates requirement of selection of a Preferred telephone number.
  • The title’s related sex will overwrite any sex value provided in the request.
  • If unspecified, AllowEmail, AllowSMS, and WithMatchToExistingCustomer will be false.
  • AccountHolderPatientID must be a valid SDS PatientID and cannot be 0 or NULL, and must have a PatientUser association.
  • RelationshipID is used in conjunction with AccountHolderPatientID. It cannot be present without AccountHolderPatientID and cannot be 0 or NULL.
  • Specific functionality if implemented by client request
    • If AllowEmail=False, Email must contain client specified email address.
    • If AllowEmail=True, Email may not contain client specified email address.
    • Username cannot contain client specified email domain.
2. This is included within the following modules: Recall API, NVI eCommerce, NVI Scheduler, SDS Scheduler 3. This is currently not Rate Limited 4. Available Versions: 1, 2, 3 Version 2 contains new response node(s): InternationalCode, ApiVersion Version 3 contains new response node(s): MatchedExistingCustomer

1. Updates an existing spectacle Rx in the database.

  • If one or both of RightEyeRx and LeftEyeRx are not included in the request, the Rx for the non-included eye side(s) will remain unchanged. If optional keys in UpdateSpectacleRxRequest model are not included in the request, or included but value is empty, the data for that specific key(s) will be unaffected.
  • Order and EHR Rx's cannot be updated with this method.

  • TempleLength: [#,#] must contain at least 2 values, comma separated.
  • GlazingCode: ["ABC"] comma separated if more then one is entered.
  • ManufacturerCode: ["ABC"] comma separated if more then one is entered.
2. This is included within the following modules: Orders API 3. This is currently not Rate Limited 4. Available Versions: 1, 3 Version 3 contains restructure of the response. New node(s): APIVersion, ColourCode, Horizontal, ED, MeasuredDCD, MeasuredBoxDBL, ProductSubType

1. Updates an existing customer record with new data. Validation requirements of the SDS ePMS application apply. The title’s related sex will overwrite any sex value provided in the request. Implementation Notes
  • PreviousForename / PreviousSurname are situationally mandatory when the Forename / Surname is being changed.
  • Specific functionality if implemented by client request
    • If AllowEmail=False, customers email address will automatically update to client specified email address.
    • If AllowEmail=True and customers email contains client specified email domain, call will fail with Error Message: "Email address may not contain client specified email domain". This will require an UpdateCustomerEmail call.
    • If AllowEmail=True and customers email does not contain client specified email address, AllowEmail flag will update to true.
    • Username cannot contain client specified email domain
2. This is included within the following modules: Recall API, NVI eCommerce, NVI Scheduler, SDS Scheduler 3. This is currently not Rate Limited 4. Available Versions: 1, 2 Version 2 contains new response node(s): InternationalCode, ApiVersion

9b4fbfba-a574-4f2f-b0ff-781352426a05.description:
1. Adds a new customer to the database using supplied data.
  • By default, validation requirements of the SDS ePMS application apply. Following optional keys in the InsertCustomerRequest model are required by the ePMS application: DateOfBirth, TitleID, Sex, PostalAddresses, TelephoneNumbers. Some required data validations can be overridden by a web.config setting AllowMinimalPatientDetails set to true. Note, if any part of the PhoneNumber model is supplied, then all required keys in that model will be required. PostalAddress can be supplied with ZipCode only. If any other portion of the PostalAddress model is included, all required keys in the model are then required.
    • If the TitleID is not supplied, the patient will be created with the 'Unknown' Title.
    • If the TitleID is supplied, the Sex is not required.
    • If Sex, or a TitleID which is associated with a Sex, is not supplied, the patient will be created with Sex as 'U' (Unknown).
    • DateOfBirth is not required if this setting is true. However, if it is included in the request, the value cannot be empty. To represent a NULL DateOfBirth, "1800-01-01" should be used.
    • This setting negates requirement of selection of a Preferred telephone number.
  • The title’s related sex will overwrite any sex value provided in the request.
  • If unspecified, AllowEmail, AllowSMS, and WithMatchToExistingCustomer will be false.
  • AccountHolderPatientID must be a valid SDS PatientID and cannot be 0 or NULL, and must have a PatientUser association.
  • RelationshipID is used in conjunction with AccountHolderPatientID. It cannot be present without AccountHolderPatientID and cannot be 0 or NULL.
  • Specific functionality if implemented by client request
    • If AllowEmail=False, Email must contain client specified email address.
    • If AllowEmail=True, Email may not contain client specified email address.
    • Username cannot contain client specified email domain.
2. This is included within the following modules: Recall API, NVI eCommerce, NVI Scheduler, SDS Scheduler 3. This is currently not Rate Limited 4. Available Versions: 1, 2, 3 Version 2 contains new response node(s): InternationalCode, ApiVersion Version 3 contains new response node(s): MatchedExistingCustomer

1. Creates a new customer in the database and links to the specified account holder customer record. This allows the account holder to perform actions on behalf of the related customer. Either the AccountHolderPatientID, or both the AccountHolderStoreReference and AccountHolderPatientReference, are required. The response includes the UserID and UserName of the AccountHolder. It also includes the AccountHolder PatientID, StoreReference, PatientReference, and Relationship of the linked patient and account holder.
  • By default, validation requirements of the SDS ePMS application apply. Some required data validations can be overridden by a web.config setting AllowMinimalPatientDetails set to true.
    • If any part of the PhoneNumber model is supplied, then all required keys in that model will be required.
    • PostalAddress can be supplied with ZipCode only. If any other portion of the PostalAddress model is included, all required keys in the model are then required.
    • If the TitleID is not supplied, the patient will be created with the 'Unknown' Title.
    • If the TitleID is supplied, the Sex is not required.
    • If Sex, or a TitleID which is associated with a Sex, is not supplied, the patient will be created with Sex as 'U' (Unknown).
    • DateOfBirth is not required if this setting is true. However, if it is included in the request, the value cannot be empty. To represent a NULL DateOfBirth, "1800-01-01" should be used.
    • This setting negates requirement of selection of a Preferred telephone number.
  • The title’s related sex will overwrite any sex value provided in the request.
  • If unspecified, WithMatchToExistingCustomer will be false.
  • Specific functionality if implemented by client request
    • If AllowEmail=False, Email must contain client specified email address.
    • If AllowEmail=True, Email may not contain client specified email address.
2. This is included within the following modules: Recall API, NVI eCommerce, SDS Scheduler 3. This is currently not Rate Limited 4. Available Versions: 1, 2 Version 2 contains new response node(s): InternationalCode, ApiVersion

c6c20755-1f3d-4fcc-8c8a-6ee8cfa5ebce.description:
1. Will Price an Order Group for the supplied customer, store, and products. This API will not create an order in the Database. Notes
  • Primary and/or Secondary Billing Plan(s) may be provided in request for pricing.
    • Plan Requests, Request Types of 'DecimalResponse' or 'IntegerResponse' will have an impact on pricing if used in plan calculations.
  • OrderDate is used as supplied in the request. If not supplied, or set as 1800-01-01T00:00:00.000, then current date/time is populated in the order created by the request.
  • OrderNumber, if specified - all order product types pertaining to that order must contain an AssociatedOrderNumber. Note: AssociatedOrderNumber must be unique for Warranty and Shipping.
  • PatientAge, will have an impact on pricing if used in plan calculations.
  • FrameSupplyType, if not present- will use Store Default Order Supply Type for the frame.
  • Pricing and Components, to return pricing from SDS and against a billing plan, values must be null. If pricing exists in the request, order will not price against SDS or billing plan and will price based on the values in the request.
  • Orders required to have a separate OrderGroup, the OrderDetail must be part of their own CartOrderGroup.
  • Left and Right Eye Rx, will have an impact on pricing if used in plan calculations.
  • OrderType and ProductType The value provided for OrderType will determine which keys in SDS.Optical.WebApi.Common.OrderProductDetail will be required. The following is a list of keys relevant to the OrderType and ProductType:
    • OrderType: Spectacle
      • Product Type: SpectacleLens
      • Side, ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription
      • Product Type: SpectacleCoating, SpectacleTint, SpectacleTintQualifier, SpectacleService, Frame
      • Side, ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription.
      • Product Type: FramePart, SpectaclePrism, Glazing, N/A
    • OrderType: ContactLens
      • Product Type: ContactLens
      • Side, ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription, Quantity
      • Product Type: ContactLensTint, ContactLensComposition
      • Side, ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription
      • Product Type: CustomContactLens,N/A
    • OrderType: OTC
      • Product Type: OTC
      • ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription, Quantity, AssociatedOrderNumber.
    • OrderType: EyeExam
      • Product Type: EyeExam
      • ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription, Quantity
 2. This is included within the following modules: Orders API 3. This is currently not Rate Limited 4. Available Versions: 1, 2 Version 2 contains new response node(s): EdgeExternally, FrameSupplyType, SupplyType, OrderSubTypeCode, PatientEyecarePlanID, ApiVersion

f9f982a1-4cc3-48d2-a159-e2d63a2d6bec.description:
1. Creates an Order Group for the supplied customer, store, and products. Notes
  • ShippingAddressId must be present on every order. ShippingAddressID in the request is used to identify which address orders will be shipped to. The response will return a new Order shipping address ID.
  • OrderValue will be ignored in the request.
  • OrderDate is used as supplied in the request. If not supplied, or set as 1800-01-01T00:00:00.000, then current date/time is populated in the order created by the request.
  • When the Payment value is higher than the OrderValue, the request will return a message 'Could Not Allocate Payment Correctly.' The order(s) will still be created and full payment of the actual order value will be taken. How to handle the payment overage will need to be handled internally.
  • OrderNumber, if specified - all order product types pertaining to that order must contain an AssociatedOrderNumber. Note: AssociatedOrderNumber must be unique for Warranty and Shipping.
  • OrderNumber, if not specified - all order product types pertaining to that order will use the next available order number in SDS.
  • OrderSubTypeCode, if not present- will use Store Default Order Sub Type for the spectacle and contact product types.
  • FrameSupplyType, if not present- will use Store Default Order Supply Type for the frame.
  • EdgeExternally, if not present- will use standard default of True.
  • Shipping added as part of the OrderDetail will supersede shipping entered as part of ShippingProduct.
  • Orders required to has a separate OrderGroup, the OrderDetail must be part of their own CartOrderGroup.
  • Pricing will need to be passed in the request for both OrderSaleTypes of Remake and Warranty if pricing will not be maintained in the SDS application.
  • OrderCollectionMethodType
    • ID Values
      • 1=PickupFromStore
      • 2=SupplierSendDirectToPatient
    • OrderCollectionMethodTypeID will allow either ID or Description.
    • OrderCollectionMethodTypeID=0 is not a valid option.
    • ShipToStoreReference is required when OrderCollectionMethodTypeID = 1
    • ShippingAddressID must be removed from request when OrderCollectionMethodTypeID = 1
    • OTC OrderType will have the OrderCollectionMethodType and ShipToStoreReference suppressed.
  • LabNotes: The following characters '\' (backslash) and '"' (double quote) are invalid and will have an impact to the JSON structure
  • The following items are not implemented in this method.
    • PrinterSettings Model
    • OrderSupplierTracking Model
    • OrderCourierTracking Model
    • OrderStatus Model
    • WarrantyAllowed key
  • OrderType and ProductType The value provided for OrderType will determine which keys in SDS.Optical.WebApi.Common.OrderProductDetail will be required. The following is a list of keys relevant to the OrderType and ProductType: OrderType: Spectacle
    • Product Type: SpectacleLens Side, ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription, UncutSize, MonoPD, SegHeight.
    • Product Type: SpectacleCoating, SpectacleTint, SpectacleTintQualifier, SpectacleService, Frame Side, ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription.
    • Product Type: FramePart, SpectaclePrism, Glazing N/A
    OrderType: ContactLens
    • Product Type: ContactLens Side, ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription, Quantity, BaseCurve, Diameter, OpticalZone, CenterThickness, HasLenticulation, ContactLensDot, CustomContactLens, SecondBaseCurve, SecondaryRadius, IntermediateRadius, PoweCurve, FirstWidth, SecondWidth, ThirdWidth
    • Product Type: ContactLensTint, ContactLensComposition Side, ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription
    • Product Type: CustomContactLens N/A
    OrderType: OTC
    • Product Type: OTC ProductType, ManufacturerCode, ProductCode, ProductDescription, Quantity, AssociatedOrderNumber.
    OrderType: EyeExam - N/A
  • OrderSubTypeCode, if not present- will use Store Default Order Sub Type for the spectacle and contact product types.
  • FrameSupplyType, if not present- will use Store Default Order Supply Type for the frame.
  • EdgeExternally, if not present- will use standard default of True.
2. This is included within the following modules: Orders API, NVI eCommerce 3. This is currently not Rate Limited 4. Available Versions: 1, 2 Version 2 contains new response node(s): EdgeExternally, FrameSupplyType, SupplyType, OrderSubTypeCode, PatientEyecarePlanID, ApiVersion

  • If one or both of RightEyeRx and LeftEyeRx are not included in the request, the Rx for the non-included eye side(s) will remain unchanged. If optional keys in UpdateContactRxRequest model are not included in the request, or included but value is empty, the data for that specific key(s) will be unaffected.
  • The Rx and measurements must be compatible with the contact lens product in the request.
  • Order and EHR Rx's cannot be updated with this method.

06087dd2-5938-4f55-96a8-951f386ad82c.description:
1. Creates a new customer in the database and links to the specified account holder customer record. This allows the account holder to perform actions on behalf of the related customer. Either the AccountHolderPatientID, or both the AccountHolderStoreReference and AccountHolderPatientReference, are required. The response includes the UserID and UserName of the AccountHolder. It also includes the AccountHolder PatientID, StoreReference, PatientReference, and Relationship of the linked patient and account holder.
  • By default, validation requirements of the SDS ePMS application apply. Some required data validations can be overridden by a web.config setting AllowMinimalPatientDetails set to true.
    • If any part of the PhoneNumber model is supplied, then all required keys in that model will be required.
    • PostalAddress can be supplied with ZipCode only. If any other portion of the PostalAddress model is included, all required keys in the model are then required.
    • If the TitleID is not supplied, the patient will be created with the 'Unknown' Title.
    • If the TitleID is supplied, the Sex is not required.
    • If Sex, or a TitleID which is associated with a Sex, is not supplied, the patient will be created with Sex as 'U' (Unknown).
    • DateOfBirth is not required if this setting is true. However, if it is included in the request, the value cannot be empty. To represent a NULL DateOfBirth, "1800-01-01" should be used.
    • This setting negates requirement of selection of a Preferred telephone number.
  • The title’s related sex will overwrite any sex value provided in the request.
  • If unspecified, WithMatchToExistingCustomer will be false.
  • Specific functionality if implemented by client request
    • If AllowEmail=False, Email must contain client specified email address.
    • If AllowEmail=True, Email may not contain client specified email address.
2. This is included within the following modules: Recall API, NVI eCommerce, SDS Scheduler 3. This is currently not Rate Limited 4. Available Versions: 1, 2 Version 2 contains new response node(s): InternationalCode, ApiVersion
